sourcing.instructions: Li: Purchase from chemical suppliers (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich); Ni: Buy from metal supply stores; P: Obtain from chemical supply companies; Tc: Source from specialized isotope suppliers (ensure proper licensing).
steps: Li: Purchase from chemical suppliers (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich); Ni: Buy from metal supply stores; P: Obtain from chemical supply companies; Tc: Source from specialized isotope suppliers (ensure proper licensing).

1. Weigh out 16.5 g of lithium. 2. Weigh out 49.5 g of nickel. 3. Weigh out 12 g of phosphorus. 4. Weigh out 2.5 g of technetium. 5. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic bowl. 6. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the dry powders until a uniform blend is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 16.5 g of lithium. 2. Weigh out 49.5 g of nickel. 3. Weigh out 12 g of phosphorus. 4. Weigh out 2.5 g of technetium. 5. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic bowl. 6. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the dry powders until a uniform blend is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible. 2. Heat in a muffle furnace at 800°C for 2 hours. 3. Ensure the heating rate is gradual, approximately 10°C/minute to avoid thermal shock.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible. 2. Heat in a muffle furnace at 800°C for 2 hours. 3. Ensure the heating rate is gradual, approximately 10°C/minute to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. This process should take about 3-4 hours. Do not force cool to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. This process should take about 3-4 hours. Do not force cool to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (320 grit) to smooth any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to the surface to enhance durability, following the manufacturer’s instructions for curing time (usually 24 hours).
